decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years
from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - Development shall not commence until details of the service bollards,
which shall be in general accordance with the portfolio of finishes
submitted with the planning application, have been submitted to and
approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved bollards
shall be installed and in full working order before any boats are moored and
maintained as such thereafter.
Condition : 3 - None of the moorings shall be used for residential purposes.

Condition : 4 - No boats shall be moored until a scheme of signage for the display of
mooring information (including the proposed notice board) has been
submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The
approved scheme shall be implemented before any boats are moored and
retained and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place during the bird breeding
season for Heron (1 March ? 31 May inclusive).

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work shall take place except between the hours
of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Fridays and 8am to 1pm on Saturdays. No
demolition or construction work shall take place on Sundays or public
holidays.

Condition : 7 - No boats shall be moored until a scheme for the removal, storage and
disposal of liquid and/or hazardous wastes (including fuels, oils and
general boat effluent) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the
local planning authority. The moorings and boats using them shall be
operated in accordance with the approved scheme at all times.

Condition : 8 - The visitor moorings shall be made available for use prior to the leisure
moorings being made available. They shall be retained and maintained
thereafter as visitor moorings

Condition : 9 - Development shall not commence until foul water drainage details, including
a timetable for the implementation of works, have been submitted to and
approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall
be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 10 - The development hereby permitted shall at all times be operated in
accordance with the Brentford Moorings ? Ferry Quays Operational
Management Plan revision B dated November 2008 unless otherwise agreed in
writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the submitted plans the
easternmost pier enclosing the visitor berth should be 16.5m in length.
The minimum width of the visitor berth shall be 2.5m.
description: Proposed fully serviced leisure and visitor moorings
